NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism: Data can be exported in OCDS format and it's published in the Open Contracting Dashboards API as specified here: https://ocexplorer.dgstg.org/swagger-ui.html

privacyComplianceList: We work with governments and implementing organizations to apply the local data protection laws. We have a Data Privacy policy publicly available.

preventHarm.additionalInfoMechanismProcessesPolicies:
- We recommend and use security certificates in our deployments, as well as best practices that are aligned with the government or organization hosting the application. 
 - Use an irreversible encryption key to store passwords so they can’t be guessed if hacked. 
- As part of the deployment, we advise on secure hosting of the platform after we transferred hosting to the county recommending use of a secure cloud environment using only secure certificates so that it's difficult to tamper with the deployed platform.

typesOfDataCollected: Names and emails for the government desk officers
Emails from the public that would require updates for certain tenders
Phone, email and mailing address to individuals and institutions that are assigned as contact points in tenders (as specified by the OCDS)
dataPrivacySecurity.privacySecurityDescription:
- Strong password policy including requirements so that registered users can't use simple passwords (e.g. use of numbers, length, complexity rules) 
 - Accounts can be deleted by administrators only (for registered users) - centralized administration so that the government agency has control over employee access. 
 - The extent of the personal data collected  is names and emails of platforms users for login/notifications exclusively. 
 - From the public, they can be subscribed for updates via email; we don’t collect names, just email addresses that are not published in the portal, only used internally for notifications. 
 - Explicit mandate to not publishing data for evaluation committees; in the procurement process there’s an evaluation committee and documentation in which you could see the names and contact info of evaluators. There was concern this would be open to harassment/reduce transparency in the procurement process.
